subject: RE: [junit] JUnit fossilized at 3.8.1?
msgSnippet: ... Yes ... it was not an announcement of it being released but that people could check it out and try it out and that the biggest change was annotations. I
messageBody:
--- Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:

> junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > I just heard Kent's developer testing presentation
> > from Agitar today and he mentioned that JUnit 4.0
> can
> > actually be checked out of CVS and the biggest
> change
> > is for support for annotations from Java 5.
>
> He also said that he can't commit to a date, but
> that we should "expect a
> release in the near future".
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
>

Yes ... it was not an announcement of it being
released but that people could check it out and try it
out and that the biggest change was annotations. I did
get the impression that this was the biggest change in
4.0.

Cheers
Shane




Shane Mingins

shanemingins@...

please remove clothes before emailing
